nodes.name: Inside Maridia Tube
nodes.note: Represents the inside of the tube; unlocking this node breaks the tube

nodes.name: Above Maridia Tube
nodes.note: Represents the area just above the tube; unlocking this node breaks the tube

nodes.name: Below Maridia Tube
nodes.note: Represents the area just below the tube; unlocking this node breaks the tube

to.note: This direct link involves using an adjacent room without water physics to initiate a jump that takes Samus through the top door. The runway is to get enough speed to clear the edge of the tube. This wouldn't work for a submerged runway rendered usable by Gravity, but Gravity renders this strat redundant anyway.

strats.name: Suitless Base
strats.note: Doesn't require canSuitlessMaridia because there is no risk, nor anything tricky whatsoever.

strats.name: Maridia Tube Clip
strats.note: This could have been a notable strat, but not with such a specific tech already tied to it.

strats.name: Suitless Base
strats.note: Doesn't require canSuitlessMaridia because there is no risk, nor anything tricky whatsoever.

strats.name: Suitless Base
strats.note: Doesn't require canSuitlessMaridia because there is no risk, nor anything tricky whatsoever.

nodes.name: Morph Passage
nodes.note: It's not quite a door, but it is a morph passage transition to another room

strats.name: Suitless Frozen Enemies
note: It's possible to do consecutive walljumps off a frozen Skultera.
That negates the need to user a super to freeze a Sciser in mid-air.

strats.name: Main Street Bottom Crab Climb
strats.note: One super needed to freeze a Sciser in mid-air.

to.note: The short charge actually has 2 steep up tiles, but one is against a wall so it was excluded

strats.name: Main Street Top Crab Climb
strats.note: Two supers needed to freeze Scisers in mid-air.

to.note: This link mostly exists because it will become useful as an alternate to walljumping. IBJ can't be done from 5 to 4 and must be directly from 1.

strats.name: Suitless
strats.note: A midair springball jump is *doable* here, but you need to start to move laterally before the pause happens which is on another level of difficulty

nodes.name: Morph Passage
nodes.note: It's not quite a door, but it is a morph passage transition to another room

strats.name: Shinespark
strats.note: This requires one shinespark to open the door and a second to get in it.

strats.name: Shinespark
note: This is suitless only, because with Gravity, another path allows actual access to 5 instead.
That path goes 3 -> 7 -> 2 -> 5.

to.note: One-way link for diagonal suitless shinesparking.

strats.name: Grapple Powamp
strats.note: Requires canUseEnemies because this wouldn't work without the Powamp being there.

strats.name: Mt. Everest Insane Walljump
strats.note: There is a ridiculously precise, but possible, walljump to get up there.

strats.name: Mt. Everest Dash Jump
strats.note: The run and jump is done from the left peak of node 7, not the right one.

strats.name: Grapple Powamp
strats.note: Requires canUseEnemies because this wouldn't work without the Powamp being there.

strats.name: Mt. Everest Bottom Crab Climb
strats.note: Requires one Super to do mid-air freezing.

strats.name: Grapple Powamp
note: Requires canUseEnemies because this wouldn't work without the Powamp being there.
No version with Gravity because Gravity alone already gets you there.

to.note: Direct link for shinespark and grapple
Direct link for shinespark and grapple

strats.name: Suitless Grapple
note: This strat uses the grapple blocks at the top left, not the Powamp.
The blocks are technically reachable without a jump assist, but it's very finicky so it's excluded.
Failure also doesn't usually allow a second try (assuming the Powamp is not there).

strats.name: Suitless Powamp Grapple
strats.note: Requires canUseEnemies because this wouldn't work without the Powamp being there.

strats.name: Mt. Everest Top Crab Climb
strats.note: Requires one Super for mid-air freezing.

to.note: No Powamp grapple strat because that is covered by 11 -> 9 -> 1.

strats.name: CanFly
strats.note: Technically an IBJ would have to be done from node 8, but it's here instead on the basis that 11->8 has no reqs, in order to make pathing more linear

strats.name: Powamp Grapple
strats.note: Requires canUseEnemies because this wouldn't work without the Powamp being there.

strats.name: Base
strats.note: GGG isn't required if the left door is accessible without it. The runway is opened by traveling betwen 1 and 2.

strats.name: Turtle Herding Shinespark
note: All this essentially give is the ability to do a 22-tile charge instead of 18 or so in-room.
Is it worth a complex strat?
This involves getting all baby turtles to the edge of the pit so you can take a hit off mama then short charge.

strats.name: Mama Turtle Insane Walljump
note: Not sure if this should have its own tech?
Have to do a running stationary spinjump from a precise spot, to do a delayed walljump with slightly more speed off the wall one tile further out.
This makes it possible to just barely walljump off the grapple block.

nodes.name: Bottom Right Door to Warehouse Entrance
Top Right Door to Crab Hole

strats.name: Suited Frozen Sciser
note: The easiest way is probably to freeze a crab on the end of the ceiling, top walljump off it.
Then it's possible to stand on it for an easy mid-air morph.

strats.name: Suitless HiJump Crab Hole Ascent
note: Stand on a frozen crab, then freeze a second one on the edge of the hole.
It's reachable with crouch jump + downgrab.

strats.name: Suitless Springball Crab Hole Ascent
note: Similar to the HiJump version.
But instead of standing on a crab on the floor, requires a Super for mid-air freezing.

strats.name: Crab Hole Crab Climb
note: Needs a Super for mid-air freezing.
Then get on that crab, possibly using a door ledge, and freeze a second crab on the edge of the wall to get on top of it.
